articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il
Demolition of Concrete Wall Urged
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket by family members of Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr Zhang Weihua on the occasion of the New Year Juche 95 (2006).
 It was conveyed to an official concerned on Thursday by Zhang Qi, grandson of Zhang Weihua, now staying in the DPRK.

articles.title: Repeal of "North Korean Human Rights Act" in U.S. Demanded
articles.content:
Demolition of Concrete Wall Urged 
    Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The Sri Lanka Committee for the Reunification of Korea issued a statement on Dec. 22 strongly demanding the immediate demolition of the concrete wall, a symbol of division and confrontation.
 Recalling that the concrete wall more cursed than the "security barrier" built by Israel still remains on the Korean Peninsula, the statement said it is a bitter insult to humankind to keep the nation with one and the same language and custom into two.    
 The statement bitterly denounced the act of keeping the wall blocking the cause of reunification and the unity of the Korean nation as a violation of human rights in the civilized world.

articles.title: Reception Hosted by Ministry of Foreign Affairs
articles.content:
Repeal of "North Korean Human Rights Act" in U.S. Demanded 
    Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- More than 1,800 members of religious organizations of south Korea including the Council of Christian Churches demanded the repeal of the "North Korean Human Rights Act" in the United States, according to MBC of south Korea.
 In the "declaration on the situation in 2005" issued on Dec. 26 they said that the act seriously distorted the core of human rights, holding that the act be abolished without delay.

Health Homepage Opens 
    Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The Hospital attached to Pyongyang University of Medicine has opened health homepage "Jangsaeng".
 The homepage helps people get hygienic common knowledge and manage their health by themselves in a scientific and technical way.
 It consists of 7 parts -- "Diseases families should know", "Possible symptoms in life and counter-measures", "Special treatment of Hospital attached to Pyongyang University of Medicine", "Long life in good health and natural remedies", "Common drugs to be used in families" and "Information of new technologies".    
 Now more than 1,500 data have been input into the homepage. It opens all the day round.    
 The homepage, the first of its kind in the public health sector of the country, is operated by the Public Health Management Study Room of the hospital.
 Its members are preparing to operate computer notice board and consultation page.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy
Floral Baskets to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy
    Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent a floral basket to the Cuban embassy here on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of the Cuban revolution triumph.
 The floral basket was handed to Ruben Perez Valdes, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, on Friday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects KPA Combined Unit
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to Cuban Embassy
    Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a basket of flowers and a congratulatory letter by the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the New Year Juche 95 (2006).
 They were conveyed to an official concerned today by Giraldo Abreu Morales, military attache of the Cuban embassy, on behalf of the corps.
